meeting_summary: The Board approved several contracts and equipment purchases totaling over $2 million, including equipment bonds and a fire truck bond. Public comments addressed homelessness concerns in Kelley Park, with discussion of potential solutions. The Board dealt with Ethics Board vacancy discussions and various administrative matters.

votes.motion_description: Appoint Daryl St. Louis to the position of Mechanic
Grant Peggy Crawford permission to utilize Wiswall Park on 10/15/25 from 7:00pm until 9:00pm for the 1st Annual Charlie Kirk Day

discussion.speaker: Mayor Rossi
discussion.statement: noted that proof of insurance was received this afternoon

discussion.speaker: The Board
discussion.statement: clarified for the public that this is not a Village event

votes.notes: A permit will be issued upon proof of insurance. Proof of insurance was received.

votes.motion_description: Pay $12,100.00 to the Ballston Area Recreation Commission per the attached contract and as stated in the 2025-2026 Budget
votes.notes: Authorizing the Mayor to execute the contract

votes.motion_description: Pay $12,500.00 to the Ballston Area Seniors per the attached contract and as stated in the 2025-2026 Budget
votes.notes: Authorizing the Mayor to execute the contract

votes.motion_description: Accept the bids offered from Auctions International for two separate auctions that both ended this week
votes.notes: Authorizes the Mayor to finalize/execute any related paperwork

votes.motion_description: Approve Tower Structure License Agreement between New Cingular Wireless PCS, LLC (d/b/a AT&T Wireless) and the Village of Ballston Spa
votes.notes: Authorizing the Mayor to execute the agreement

votes.motion_description: Approve Change Order #3 for USG Water Solutions related to the delay costs related to the John St. Tower exterior painting
votes.notes: These costs are to be absorbed by the carriers through pending agreements. This motion authorizes the Mayor to execute the Change Order.

votes.motion_description: Have Village administration send a Request for Quotes for telephonic language interpretation services to specific vendors
votes.notes: Vendors: Language Line Solutions; Geneva Worldwide, Inc.; Transperfect Translations International, Inc.

votes.motion_description: Accept the resignation of John Battenfield from the Planning Board

Approve Memorandum of Understanding between the Capital Region Transportation Council and the Village of Ballston Spa for the Village-Wide Traffic Calming Master Plan, including $7,500 of Village matching funds
votes.notes: Authorizing the Mayor to execute the Memorandum of Understanding

votes.motion_description: Approve Spectrum Business agreement with the Village of Ballston Spa for a Lowell Street Pump Station phone line for $30/month for 36 months
votes.notes: Contingent on the inability of RingSquared to provide the necessary service for that location. This motion authorizes the Mayor to execute the agreement if it is determined that the inability exists.

votes.motion_description: Approve Resolution Authorizing the Purchase of Equipment at a Cost up to $1,236,000 and the Issuance of $1,100,000 Serial Bonds for the Purchase of One (1) Vacuum Truck, One (1) Street Sweeper, Two (2) Dump Trucks, One (1) Loader and One (1) Pickup Truck with Plow
votes.notes: This resolution formalizes authorization, which is needed for the closing of the loan per USDA requirements.

votes.motion_description: Approve Resolution Authorizing the Issuance of $942,000 Serial Bonds for the Purchase of a Sutphen Pumper Fire Truck
votes.notes: This resolution formalizes authorization, which is needed for the closing of the loan per USDA requirements.

votes.motion_description: Enter into Executive Session to discuss an active police investigation matter
votes.notes: The Board and Officer DeMartino entered Executive Session at 8:42pm and returned at 9:14pm

votes.motion_description: Schedule regular Board meeting on 10/27 to begin at 6:30pm, and a Special Meeting will begin immediately thereafter with a goal time of 7:00pm related to zoning
Audit vouchers and adjourn the meeting

liaison_reports.report: Trustee VanDeinse-Perez congratulated the BSBPA on another great car show and noted that Small Business Saturday will be 11/29. On 11/20 from 6:00pm to 8:00pm there will be a Revitalize Ballston Spa (BOA) public workshop held at the solar building. Trustee VanDeinse-Perez said there will be a graphic design wrap put around the Ricketts site, paid for with grant money.

announcements.detail: graphic design wrap put around the Ricketts site, paid for with grant money

liaison_reports.report: Trustee Price-Bush announced that the Library received a $50,000.00 grant from Stewarts that will go towards the new teen room. Check the Library calendar for upcoming events such as an afternoon book discussion on 10/22 at 3:30pm, Paws to Read with Georgie the therapy dog on 10/25 starting at 11:30am and a book signing by on 10/28 at 6:30pm by Ballston Spa resident Jerry Crouth, who authored "Thank you Mom". Sixth through ninth graders can enjoy teen nights at BACC on Monday and Friday nights from 6:30pm to 8:30pm. Trustee Price-Bush announced that the Community Thanksgiving meal will be held at Union Fire House. Volunteers are needed the night before Thanksgiving and on Thanksgiving Day. Volunteers should contact Ray Otten.

events.event: Paws to Read with Georgie the therapy dog

announcements.detail: Library received a $50,000.00 grant from Stewarts for new teen room

action_items: Contact Ray Otten to volunteer for Thanksgiving meal

liaison_reports.report: Trustee Baskin noted that the Committee on the Arts is having a "Watercolor Fanatics" art class at the Real McCoy Details can be found on their Facebook page. Open mic night will be held at the establishment on 11/7 beginning at 5:30pm. Additionally, the committee is looking for another volunteer. Trustee Baskin also shared that Saratoga Arts is currently accepting grant applications through 11/21. The Park and Tree Board has been performing maintenance on trees in Wiswall and Kelley Parks and on Milton Avenue and Low Street. The Park and Tree Board thanks Frank Blair and his son Scott for repairs done to the playground at Kelley Park. A workday is being planned for later this fall or early next spring.

announcements.detail: Committee on the Arts looking for another volunteer
Frank Blair and his son Scott did repairs to the playground at Kelley Park

liaison_reports.report: Trustee Raymond reported that the DPW is going to be doing a hydrant flush and also noted that loose leaf and debris pick-up will begin 10/15.

other_business.speaker: Multiple Trustees
other_business.update: Trustee Baskin would like the vacant position on the Ethics Board put on the website. Mayor Rossi noted he feels it is better to wait until the current ethics investigations are completed. Trustee VanDeinse-Perez doesn't see the harm in putting names together to start the process. Mayor Rossi hopes the cases will be expedited. Trustee Raymond feels there is no need to wait for the current investigations to be over in order to appoint a new member.
action_items: Resolve Ethics Board vacancy posting decision

other_business.update: The Board discussed what events require a permit and what events do not.

other_business.speaker: The Board
other_business.update: A workshop was tentatively scheduled for 10/20 at 6:30pm.

other_business.speaker: Multiple Trustees
other_business.update: Trustee Raymond said the homelessness issue is going to get worse as programs get defunded. Trustee Baskin noted that his neighborhood had a meeting and discussed nonresidential use in the area. Trustee Price-Bush suggested that if people are discouraged from drinking in the park, they might move on. Trustee VanDeinse-Perez noted that some people do not want help.
